intro: Scleranthus densiramaeus, commonly known as the dense-flowered sandparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to regions of Europe and western Asia, often found in dry, sandy or gravelly habitats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Scleranthus densiramaeus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in disturbed areas.
